content.raw:
Thanks for the report, I was able to reproduce the problem with my own fork of gazebo.

The reason is that bitbucket is launching different attempts (up to three) to send the same JSON event the previous one found a TIMEOUT. You can check it in the admin >> webhooks >> View requests >> View details menu of the gazebo repository.

Seems like [this is a known issue for large repositories](https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/12211/increase-the-webhook-timeout-period-or) closed at WONTFIX. That can explain why we only see it in Gazebo and not in our other repositories.

If I understand the bitbucket staff's answer correctly, they propose to handle the request fast and queue up the actions (jenkins call in our case), I assume that to be managed by a different thread.
content.html:
Thanks for the report, I was able to reproduce the problem with my own fork of gazebo.

The reason is that bitbucket is launching different attempts (up to three) to send the same JSON event the previous one found a TIMEOUT. You can check it in the admin >> webhooks >> View requests >> View details menu of the gazebo repository.

Seems like this is a known issue for large repositories closed at WONTFIX. That can explain why we only see it in Gazebo and not in our other repositories.

If I understand the bitbucket staff's answer correctly, they propose to handle the request fast and queue up the actions (jenkins call in our case), I assume that to be managed by a different thread.
